channel.title: What am I supposed to port foreward?
channel.description: OK I have port forewarded before and I did it a few days ago, but I got a new computer so its all diffrent and I guess I didn't port foreward right. Do I portforewad my routers IP or the IP 192.168.******?And here is a pic of windows firewall:[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/7557/wfireho1.jpg[/img][/URL] So don't say "Oh just go to exceptions!" because it doesn't have that...so where would I add port 43594 because I don't have it, thats why I posted the firewall

item.title: What am I supposed to port foreward?
item.dc:creator: @Amerks5 Amerks5
item.description:
@Amerks5 wrote:

Dammit I have vista :[[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2008, 12:44:10 PM[/size][hr]Anyone know how to make the port?

Read full topic
item.source: What am I supposed to port foreward?

item.title: What am I supposed to port foreward?
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

[quote=“Amerks5, post:5, topic:170152”][quote author=xx nub xx link=topic=230007.msg1971191#msg1971191 date=1199312295]
you have to log into the router with the router’s IP which is generally 192.168.1.1, then go from there. There are MANY port forwarding guides around here (dunno why no one can do it, its a snap).
[/quote]
Lol I HAVE port forewarded before, but it was a while ago and I never bothered to look at it. My routers IP is 192.160.0.1 but I portforewarded 192.168.0.100…so which do I portforeward? I did the router…and I don’t think I can add port 43594 because windows firewall is gay…[/quote]

You need to portforward 192.168.0.100, and do you have vista? if you do you should throw your computer away and buy xp.

Read full topic
item.source: What am I supposed to port foreward?

item.title: What am I supposed to port foreward?
item.dc:creator: @M00_M00_Pk M00 M00 Pk
item.description:
@M00_M00_Pk wrote:

You use yr routers ip, to find out what that is:

Start>Run>cmd>Type in ipconfig and press enter> It should be in there. But that might just be the 192.168.****

EDIT: Yeah it only does default… Sorry.

Read full topic
